Description: PURPOSE: LEAD THE STORMWATER STRATEGIC INITIATIVE 2.0 AND ADMINISTER A SUBAWARD PROGRAM. ACTIVITIES: FACILITATE AN ADVISORY TEAM FOR DECISION MAKING/ADAPTIVE MANAGEMENTAND COORDINATE WITH OTHER KEY STAKEHOLDERS, MAKE/MANAGE SUBAWARDS, ADDRESS CLIMATE CHANGE/ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE IMPACTS. DELIVERABLES: TOXICS IN FISH, FRESHWATER STREAM, AND MARINE WATER QUALITY IMPLEMENTATION STRATEGIES/ADAPTIVE MANAGEMENT. OUTCOMES: REDUCE TOXICS, HEALTHIER FRESHWATER STREAMS, IMPROVED MARINE WATER QUALITY. BENEFICIARIES: PEOPLE WHO EAT FISH OR SWIM IN PUGET SOUND. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE: GREEN STORMWATER INFRASTRUCTURE, BEST MANAGEMENT PRACTICES, OUTREACH/EDUCATION, ACTIONS TO PREVENT TOXICS POLLUTION

PURPOSE: SUPPORT THE PUGET SOUND SHELLFISH STRATEGIC INITIATIVE 2.0 AND ITS SUBAWARD PROGRAM. ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: UPDATE THE SHELLFISH IMPLEMENTATION STRATEGY. LEAD DECISIONMAKING, OVERSIGHT/ADAPTIVE MANAGEMENT OF EPA PUGET SOUND SHELLFISH FUNDS FOR SHELLFISH PROTECTION/RECOVERY (E.G. MANURE, PET WASTE, SEPTIC SYSTEMS), COORDINATE WITH STAKEHOLDERS. MAKE/MANAGE SUBAWARDS, PLAN FOR CLIMATE CHANGE. DELIVERABLES, EXPECTED OUTCOMES: UPDATED SHELLFISH IMPLEMENTATION STRATEGY/SUBAWARD PLAN, CONTRACTING AND SUBAWARDEE PROGRESS/REPORTING. OUTCOMES: REDUCE PATHOGEN SOURCES, UPGRADE SHELLFISH ACRES IN PUGET SOUND. BENEFICIARIES: PUGET SOUND SHELLFISH HARVESTERS- COMMERCIAL GROWERS, TRIBES, THE PUBLIC. PEOPLE WHO VISIT BEACHES OR FRESHWATER STREAMS IN PUGET SOUND WILL BENEFIT FROM REDUCED EXPOSURE TO PATHOGENS. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: AGRICULTURAL BMPS, FIND AND FIX SOURCES OF FECAL POLLUTION, OUTREACH/EDUCATION, ETC.

THIS AWARD IS TO LEAD THE WORK OF THE PUGET SOUND HABITAT STRATEGIC INITIATIVE LEAD (HABITAT SIL) TO DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT PRIORITIES IDENTIFIED IN THE ACTION AGENDA AND IMPLEMENTATION STRATEGIES, CONTINUE TO ADAPTIVELY MANAGE IMPLEMENTATION STRATEGIES, AND TO ADMINISTER NATIONAL ESTUARY PROGRAM (NEP) FUNDS. THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT IS PARTIALLY FUNDED.

AS THE CORE SUPPORT FOR LEADERSHIP AND STEWARDSHIP OF PUGET SOUND SCIENCE, THIS WORK PLAN SUPPORTS THREE CONCURRENT TASKS:  TASK 1: SCIENCE SUPPORT FOR PARTIALLY COMPLETED AND ANTICIPATED IMPLEMENTATION STRATEGIES (ISS).  TASK 2: SCIENCE SUPPORT FOR BALANCED AND COMPREHENSIVE ECOSYSTEM APPROACHES.  TASK 3: OPEN, TRANSPARENT AND PRODUCTIVE EVALUATION, INTEGRATION, AND COMMUNICATION OF SCIENCE, INCLUDING RIGOROUS SCIENCE REVIEW, QUESTIONING AND EVALUATING.

THE WASHINGTON DEPARTMENT OF ECOLOGY WILL SERVE AS THE LEAD ORGANIZATION FOR A PROGRAM TO SUBSTANTIALLY REDUCE OR ELIMINATE TOXIC AND NUTRIENT POLLUT
THE MAIN OBJECTIVES OF THIS WATERSHED GRANT ARE TO: - USE WATERSHED INFORMATION ACROSS ALL SPATIAL AND TEMPORAL SCALES TO ADDRESS UNDERLYING PROBLEMS
